articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Harvard Faces Major Federal Funding Cuts Amid Controversy
articles.description: The Trump administration has cut $450 million in federal grants to Harvard University, accusing it of fostering liberalism and antisemitism. Following previous funding freezes, Harvard is challenging the sanctions, while facing demands for leadership changes and policy revisions.
articles.content:
President Donald Trump's administration has slashed an additional $450 million in federal grants to Harvard University, escalating a confrontation over alleged liberalism and antisemitism at the prestigious institution.

articles.title: Trump administration plans to deploy hundreds more federal agents to ramp up immigration enforcement across the country
articles.description: The Trump administration is planning to deploy hundreds more federal personnel to ramp up arrests of undocumented immigrants as soon as this week, according to two sources familiar with the planning, including tapping Border Patrol agents to fan out nationwide.
articles.content:

articles.title: Mediation, Kashmir & trade: Delhi rebuts Trump claims point by point
articles.description: This is the strongest counter by Delhi since Saturday’s claims by Trump on the range of issues and makes clear its discomfiture with Trump wading into India-Pakistan politics and hostilities.

articles.title: Trump appeals for Qatar’s help in persuading Iran to give up nuclear programme
articles.description: Qatar over the years has played the role of intermediary between the US and Iran.
articles.content:
President Donald Trump urged Qatar to use its influence over Iran to persuade the country’s leadership to reach an agreement with the US to dial back its rapidly advancing nuclear programme.

articles.title: Trump says Iran must cease support of proxy groups as part of any nuclear deal
articles.description: The US and Iran have engaged in four rounds of talks since early last month focused on Iran’s nuclear programme.
articles.content:
US President Donald Trump has told Gulf leaders he urgently wants “to make a deal” with Iran to wind down its nuclear programme but that Tehran must end its support of proxy groups throughout the region as part of any potential agreement.
